text: @BrennanCenter I think this piece might interest you.
author: ed_kilgore

text: I got the "Third Reconstruction" framing from @RevBarberII. It's entirely appropriate. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/voting-rights-push-could-begin-a-third-reconstruction.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: The Democratic voting rights push isn't just another "issue" among others. It's the preeminent partisan conflict in the country, and could remain so until one side or the other prevails.http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/voting-rights-push-could-begin-a-third-reconstruction.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: @RevBarberII FYI. Thanks for the "Third Reconstruction"framing! http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/voting-rights-push-could-begin-a-third-reconstruction.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: Sanders' electability argument may wisely anticipate an obsession with this subject among Democratic primary voters.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Interesting that Bernie Sanders' campaign is stressing an electability argument: http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/how-electable-is-bernie-sanders-in-2020.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: Our biggest fans this week: @intelligencer, @DemFromCT, @jbview. Thank you! via https://sumall.com/thankyou?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=publishing&utm_campaign=thank_you_tweet&utm_content=text_and_media&utm_term=351dd8e6cb478f53e9398190 …
author: ed_kilgore

text: As an elder in my own church, I didn't really like writing this line: "Being churchy and being Trumpy seem to go hand in hand." Was only talking about white evangelicals and white Catholics, though.
author: ed_kilgore

text: A backlash to the backlash to Beto seems to be underway.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Hard to say if @AndrewYangVFA's UBI advocacy is on the cutting edge of history, or is a throwback to the biggest bad idea of 1972.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Wonder if the Yang Gang has taken a good luck at what happened to George McGovern when he proposed a UBI in 1972? If not, I did it for them. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/yangs-usd12-000-ubi-was-pioneered-by-george-mcgovern.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: The final indignity of Bayh's distinguished Senate career was having to hold hearings on "Billygate" when he should have been campaigning against Dan Quayle.
author: ed_kilgore

text: RIP Birch Bayh. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/birch-bayh-sponsor-of-era-author-of-title-xi-dies-at-91.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: The grief Beto is getting over how he describes his parenting responsibilities is the best sign yet we are in a new era, and that's a good thing. Other male candidates better listen up.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Haha.
author: ed_kilgore

text: FWIW, my initial assessment of Beto's candidacy. And to those who freak out at every horse-race analysis, yes, it's early, and yes, substance matters, but sorry, so does politics.
author: ed_kilgore

text: My post was adorned with a photo of the 1924 Democratic convention, the 103-ballot-affair that had many fascinating features, from the last hurrah of William Jennings Bryan to a platform fight over the KKK.
author: ed_kilgore

text: One wrinkle is that Democratic superdelegates whose first-ballot votes have been killed would spring back to life if a second ballot occurs. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/a-contested-democratic-convention-could-happen-in-2020.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: The odds of a contested convention are still low, but not negligible. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/a-contested-democratic-convention-could-happen-in-2020.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: Every four years I usually write something mocking the possibility of a contested major-party political convention. Not this time. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/a-contested-democratic-convention-could-happen-in-2020.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: Our biggest fans this week: @intelligencer, @RameshPonnuru, @vnatale. Thank you! via https://sumall.com/thankyou?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=publishing&utm_campaign=thank_you_tweet&utm_content=text_and_media&utm_term=351dd8e6cb478f53e9398190 …
author: ed_kilgore

text: Wonder if the seller was able to get the smell of brimstone out of it?
author: ed_kilgore

text: Great moments in sacrilege:
author: ed_kilgore

text: Sadly, it's clear some people think the appropriate award for their luck-driven success is to be able to start their children not just at third base, but five feet from home plate.
author: ed_kilgore

text: In a country where the filthy rich sometimes risk prison to add to their wealth, I guess it's no surprise when those of crazy high status risk prison to lift their offspring to super-elite schools. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/scandal-shows-the-very-privileged-just-cant-get-enough.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: I'm not for moving now on impeachment, but agree w/ your statement of circumstances that would get you "spun out." Me too!
author: ed_kilgore

text: What pushed marriage equality into respectability was the experience of Americans who suddenly encountered gay folk in their families, workplaces and social/religious circles--not anything politicians said or did. When this phenomenon reached critical mass, things moved quickly.
author: ed_kilgore

text: A heap of data refuting Trump's assertion that Democrats are an "anti-Jewish" and "anti-Israel" party.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Methinks Ross may be projecting his party's abandonment of the "cultural center" onto Democrats.
author: ed_kilgore

text: A response to @DouthatNYT's comment on @delong's essay on Democratic centrism. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/democrats-have-moved-with-the-country-on-cultural-issues.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: It's increasingly clear "The Wall" is Trump's symbol for his own self. He's promising to protect his supporters not only from an imaginary border crisis, but from all the change they fear.
author: ed_kilgore

text: I wasn't a big fan of Brown myself; I have problems with anyone who embraces Trump's trade agenda. But he made some strategic sense as a nominee.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Really surprised by Sherrod Brown's demurral from the presidential race. Yeah, he was nowhere in the polls, but his upside was pretty significant. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/sherrod-brown-wont-run-for-president-in-2020.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: The sustained attack on Ilhan Omar is like a bottomless crack pipe for Republicans, as I try to explain:
author: ed_kilgore

text: Thanks, Nancy.
author: ed_kilgore

text: My "red scare" piece didn't explicitly mention the possibility of a "Boy Who Cried Wolf" reaction to GOP "socialism" alarms. When you've incessantly called Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton "socialists," do you really have any credibility on the subject?
author: ed_kilgore

text: Our biggest fans this week: @intelligencer, @CitizenCohn, @ryanlcooper. Thank you! via https://sumall.com/thankyou?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=publishing&utm_campaign=thank_you_tweet&utm_content=text_and_media&utm_term=351dd8e6cb478f53e9398190 …
author: ed_kilgore

text: It's kind of shocking to realize how many moderate, even liberal, Republicans were still in office in the early 70s. Liberal Republicans have long been an extinct species.
author: ed_kilgore

text: It's a different Republican Party, with much less ideological diversity and a passionately partisan rank-and-file, that will likely defend Trump to the last ditch, unlike the Republicans who finally abandoned Nixon. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/gop-abandon-trump-like-nixon.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: If @IlhanMN had explicitly accused conservative evangelical Christians of allegiance to a foreign power, instead of creating the impression she was talking about Jews, she would have saved herself a world of trouble, while more accurately describing the actual problem.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Guess again.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Here's my parallel confession to @delong's: center-left folk are better positioned to offer advice to an ascendant Left than to serve as bridges to a non-existent center-right. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/a-new-role-for-democratic-centrists-helping-the-left-win.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: My people were generally either tee-totalers or drunks, but the latter didn't blossom until they were old enough to buy bootleg whisky or make their own.
author: ed_kilgore

text: I'm a quite a bit older than Amanda, and I drank twice my senior year, both times at academic honor society events.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Only way I could see Hickenlooper getting any traction at all is if Dems go into a full-on electability panic. But he's a long way from being well-known enough to register in general election polls versus Trump.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Hickenlooper's only ace-in-the-hole in Iowa: his cousin was a Republican senator from there for 24 years. So his name not as exotic there as elsewhere, at least among older folk. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/hickenlooper-counts-on-unconventional-path-to-the-presidency.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: Hickenlooper's presidential candidacy a pretty clear example of bad timing. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/hickenlooper-counts-on-unconventional-path-to-the-presidency.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: OK, but if you read the article its major point was to explain why Democrats are likely to be obsessed with the "horse race."
author: ed_kilgore

text: I offer my own account of Mark Penn's predictable walk down the road to TrumpLand, dating back to my first encounter with him in 1995, alongside his mentor Dick Morris.
author: ed_kilgore

text: You didn't miss much, other than three years of tedium and mental shrinkage.
author: ed_kilgore

text: To be clear, I understand @AOC doesn't need my approval. But today, at least, she's got it, and perhaps that shows her appeal goes well beyond the self-conscious Left.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Yeah, no question about that.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Thank you! I try to call things as I see them.
author: ed_kilgore

text: So should we attack her or ignore her? I'm guessing you want Charlie and me to quit our jobs and/or commit suicide.
author: ed_kilgore

text: As those who know my history, have seen me getting beat up by the Bernie People, or actually read this post, may realize, I'm probably the last passenger to climb aboard the @AOC train. But her performance today was impossible not to respect.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Our biggest fans this week: @jonfavs, @brianbeutler, @intelligencer. Thank you! via https://sumall.com/thankyou?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=publishing&utm_campaign=thank_you_tweet&utm_content=text_and_media&utm_term=351dd8e6cb478f53e9398190 …
author: ed_kilgore

text: I've repeatedly suggested that Biden shouldn't run.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Justly or not, Trump, the GOP, and their media hounds are going to attack Democrats on "reparations." They should respond without abandoning their commitment to racial justice.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Out of respect for @digby56, I will stop using this term, which I've been using for a quarter-century.  Hell,  I may have even popularized it.
author: ed_kilgore

text: I join @brianbeutler and @paulwaldman1 with my own jeremiad about Democratic presidential candidates refusing to challenge the filibuster:
author: ed_kilgore

text: OK, thanks.
author: ed_kilgore

text: The take from @PeterBeinart about Bernie and American Exceptionalism really helps explain Sanders' distinctive appeal to young voters.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Is this part of an analysis that's published somewhere? Could we get a link? Thanks.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Ironically, the creeping intrusion of other states on the Iowa/New Hampshire duopoly may save these states from a real attack on their status, if they can accept a diminished but still important role.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Be sure to remember this nearly successful RNC effort in 2009 to force Republicans to call Democrats the "Democrat Socialist Party."
author: ed_kilgore

text: Our biggest fans this week: @tlaskawy, @TucsonBlonde, @OwingsKenny. Thank you! via https://sumall.com/thankyou?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=publishing&utm_campaign=thank_you_tweet&utm_content=text_and_media&utm_term=351dd8e6cb478f53e9398190 …
author: ed_kilgore

text: To be clear, there is more than one "real" Ed Kilgore.
author: ed_kilgore

text: They should be, and certainly will be if Democrats choose a younger nominee.
author: ed_kilgore

text: One thing to keep in mind is that nominating one of the 20 or so Democratic candidates who are under 70 might make the age/health issue cut against Trump.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Maybe the candidate age issue won't matter in 2020, or maybe Biden/ Sanders are so uniquely valuable that nominating one of them is worth the risk. But it would be recklessly irresponsible for Democrats to just deny the risk altogether. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/02/will-age-be-an-issue-in-the-2020-presidential-race.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: I've gotta say: my horror at Trump's record levels of incoherence in today's Rose Garden presser was interrupted by laughter at the thought of all the inward cringing going on in Republican circles as their leader went on and on about his love of tariffs.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Spent far more time on this than on my usual four-posts-a-day and still got details wrong. Thanks for the assist.
author: ed_kilgore

text: OK, I'll update and correct; thanks.  Remarkable how confusing published reports on this have been.
author: ed_kilgore

text: OK, thanks.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Our biggest fans this week: @intelligencer, @saramead, @bad_indian_girl. Thank you! via https://sumall.com/thankyou?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=publishing&utm_campaign=thank_you_tweet&utm_content=text_and_media&utm_term=351dd8e6cb478f53e9398190 …
author: ed_kilgore

text: To put it another way, can Board Democrats order a new election on a 3-2 vote? Reporting seems to suggest they can't, but no clarity on requirements.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Big question: is unanimous vote by state election board necessary to call new election? Reporting on this is a bit confusing.
author: ed_kilgore

text: If Omar had said, "20% about the Benjamins," it wouldn't be quite so bad, though almost certainly still an exaggeration. But she didn't.
author: ed_kilgore

text: I defended Omar and Tlaib against earlier attacks on them for non-existent anti-semitic tropes. But whatever else it is, "all about the Benjamins" is just factually erroneous.  http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/02/christian-right-bigger-deal-than-aipac-in-gop-israel-policy.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: My question was rhetorical, and also addressed to those who always treat everything this peculiar man does as a "genius move."
author: ed_kilgore

text: If Trump accepts a deal he could have almost certainly gotten back in December, why didn't he at least offer to take it in that SOTU Address that was suppose to be so conciliatory?
author: ed_kilgore

text: If, as seems increasingly likely, Trump caves on border funding after putting the country through a government shutdown, he will deserve all the mockery he gets from the left and grief he gets from the right. He started this fire all by himself. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/02/trump-quietly-lays-groundwork-for-surrender-on-border-fight.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: Pretty big gulf opening up between where most Democrats are on school choice issues, and where Cory Booker has been. How will he deal with that? Shift, ignore it, or double down?
author: ed_kilgore

text: You know what? I'm from the Deep South, and am older than all these Virginia dudes, but never encountered blackface "performances." Is this some sort of frat-boy thing?
author: ed_kilgore

text: Seem to recall Congress found a way to get involved in 1876.
author: ed_kilgore

text: I don't know why people are so sure Trump would relinquish power if he loses a close election with the usual suspects screaming about "voter fraud." But anything that can be done to take that possibility off the table is a vitally patriotic act.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Democrats should spend less time fruitlessly trying to get Republicans to help them to eject Trump from office before 2020 and more time ensuring he's ejected if he loses. http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/02/dont-let-trump-use-voter-fraud-claims-to-challenge-defeat.html …
author: ed_kilgore

text: I recall that Bob Dole got into hot water in 1976 for describing (in the Veep debate) America's major military conflicts as "Democrat wars."
author: ed_kilgore

text: I was on vacation, but thanks for noticing.
author: ed_kilgore

text: Our biggest fans this week: @intelligencer, @johnastoehr, @BruceLesley. Thank you! via https://sumall.com/thankyou?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=publishing&utm_campaign=thank_you_tweet&utm_content=text_and_media&utm_term=351dd8e6cb478f53e9398190 …

text: My original subhed for this piece, which editors apparently did not like, was: "Shutdowns Is Dumb."
author: ed_kilgore
